name: 2. Dataset Definition and Data Preparation
content:
Dataset Description & Data Preparation


Dataset Description

We are using four datasets, each providing complementary information required for payer payment rate analytics:

  1. Patient Data
  • Description: Contains demographic and personal details of patients.
  • Key Attributes:
  • Birth Date, Death Date (for calculating patient age and survival info)
  • Gender
  • Ethnicity, Race
  • Marital Status
  1. Payers Data
  • Description: Provides details about insurance companies (payers) responsible for covering patient claims.
  • Key Attributes:
  • Unique Customer Identifier
  • Amount Covered (by payer)
  • Amount Uncovered (out-of-pocket by patient)
  • Payer Name / Insurance Provider
  1. Encounters Data
  • Description: Captures information about patient interactions with healthcare organizations.
  • Key Attributes:
  • Encounter ID
  • Organization Name / Facility
  • Associated Payer
  • Total Claim Cost
  • Payer Coverage
  1. Observations Data
  • Description: Contains medical test results and diagnostic observations.
  • Key Attributes:
  • Encounter ID, Patient ID
  • Height, Weight
  • Other diagnostic measurements (used in clinical risk adjustment)


Data Preparation

To prepare the datasets for analysis and model development:

1.Data Integration

  • Join Encounters Data and Observations Data using Patient ID and Encounter ID.
  • Merge the result with Patient Data on Patient ID.
  • Join with Payers Data on Payer ID or payer name.

2.Feature Engineering

  • Patient Age: Calculate from Birth Date (and Death Date, if applicable).
  • Payment Rate Calculation:\text{PAYER_PAYMENT_RATE} = \frac{\text{PAYER_COVERAGE}}{\text{TOTAL_CLAIM_COST}}Represents the percentage of claim covered by the payer.
  • Categorical Conversion: Convert PAYER_PAYMENT_RATE into classes/tiers (e.g., Low Coverage, Medium Coverage, High Coverage).

3.Data Cleaning

  • Handle missing demographic or payer values.
  • Normalize categorical fields (e.g., Ethnicity, Marital Status).
  • Standardize test results (e.g., height/weight units).

4.Final Dataset

  • A unified dataset containing patient demographics, encounter costs, payer details, and diagnostic information, enriched with derived features like age and payer payment rate class.
